summary: This is an email chain from July 25, 2019, discussing an incident at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York where Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a noose around his neck on the morning of July 24, 2019. The email involves a Supervisory Staff Attorney at CLC and a Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal, and mentions that Epstein's cellmate reported being threatened.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual at the center of the reported incident; found in his cell with a noose around his neck and placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Supervisory Staff Attorney CLC
persons.context: The sender of the main email, seeking clarification and additional information about the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein from the USMS.

persons.name: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal Southern District of New York
persons.context: The forwarder of the initial report from the Bureau of Prisons detailing the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Associate Warden (AW) at MCC New York
persons.context: The Bureau of Prisons official who advised the USMS of the incident where Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell.

connections.person2: Associate Warden (AW) at MCC New York
connections.description: The Associate Warden is a prison official responsible for the facility where Epstein is incarcerated and reported on his condition.

connections.person2: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal Southern District of New York
connections.description: The attorney is corresponding with the marshal to obtain and verify information about the Epstein incident.

events.title: Epstein Found with Noose in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck. He was taken to medical, placed on suicide watch, and later downgraded to suicide observation.
personsInvolved: Associate Warden (AW) at MCC New York

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at 1:27 AM on July 24, 2019, with a noose around his neck.
Epstein was initially placed on suicide watch and later downgraded to suicide observation following the incident.
Epstein's cellmate reported that Epstein had threatened to kill him, according to the Associate Warden.
The incident was under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons at the time of the email.
